translated: The Story of the Ghost with Sixty-thousand Spikes
“Why do you run about like one demented,
like a wild animal caught in a trap?
Without a doubt you are a doer of evil deeds,
why do you cry out so?”
a bad destination, a world of Yama;
I have gone from here to the ghost realm.
“What evil was done by body, speech,
By the result of what deed
the well-disciplined one, the one with developed faculties;
Seated at the root of a tree,
With a piece of Sal-tree blossom,
By the result of that deed,
I’m going to experience this suffering.”
The story of the ghost with the sixty-thousand spikes is the sixteenth.
a crowd, pāṭali, and a forest.
A tree, a snake, a treasure,
a merchant, a young man, sixty thousand;
and that’s why it’s called a sub-chapter.
And the summary of the sub-chapters:
the short, the long, in four ways;
in four ways, by recitation section.
